intro: Euphrasia rectiflora, commonly known as the straight-flowered eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its characteristic appearance. Euphrasia rectiflora is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in partial shade.
